Original Requirements: Create a function that formats a timestamp into a human-readable time string.
Product Goals: Provide an easy-to-use function for formatting timestamps.
User Stories: As a developer, I want to be able to format a timestamp into a human-readable string.
As a user, I want to be able to choose the format of the time string.
As a user, I want to be able to specify the timezone of the timestamp.
Competitive Analysis: moment.js: A popular JavaScript library for formatting timestamps.
date-fns: A lightweight JavaScript library for formatting timestamps.
luxon: A modern JavaScript library for working with dates and times.
Competitive Quadrant Chart:
quadrantChart
    title "Reach and engagement of campaigns"

Requirement Analysis: The function should be able to format a timestamp into a human-readable string. The function should support multiple time formats. The function should handle timezones correctly.
Requirement Pool: The function should be able to format a timestamp into a human-readable string.
The function should support multiple time formats.
The function should handle timezones correctly.
